Download

  • Plasmacore v3.2.6 (2011.02.22, Windows/Mac/Linux/iPhone/iPad/Android/WindowsPhone7)
  • To start a new project, unzip the file above, open in a command prompt in the new_project folder, and type:
  • Windows: 
 gogo build
  • Mac, Linux: 
 chmod +x gogo
 ./gogo build
  • To upgrade an existing project, run "gogo upgrade" once to upgrade the core module, run "gogo" to finish the install, and then run "gogo upgrade" once more time to upgrade the auxiliary modules.

3.2 Overview

  • Completely revamped the Slag virtual machine and C++ cross-compiler. Both are now native 64-bit compatible and cross-compiled C++ code is about 60% faster than before. Minor search & replace name changes are required for existing native libraries; e.g. "SVM_PUSH_INT32(x);" becomes "SLAG_PUSH_INT32(x);".
  • Added support for Linux and Windows Phone 7.
  • Introspection support has been removed for the time being - it may well be added back later.


Change Log for 3.2.6 (February 22, 2011)

  • General:
  • KeyEvent::is_press(), is_repeat(), and is_release() can now be called without specifying a particular key as a parameter.
  • Added GenericImage::bounding_quad().Quad that returns a correct bounding area given an image's angle as well as its position, size, scale, and handle.
  • Added convenience initializers Box(Real64 x, Real64 y, Real64 size), Box(Vector2 pos,Real64 size), and Box(Vector2 pos, Real64 x, Real64 y).
  • Added convenience method Box::relative_to(Int32 handle_constant).Box. For example, to get a 100x100 box centered around the mouse: "Box(Input.mouse_position,100,100).relative_to(Handle.center)". To get a 200x100 box in the bottom right corner of the display: "Box(Display.size,200,100).relative_to(Handle.bottom_right)".
  • Modified GenericImage::bounding_box() to return a Box that completely encloses the image's bounding_quad(). If the angle is orthogonal (0,90,180,270) then the bounding box will be the same as in previous versions of Plasmacore.
  • Modified AnimatedImage to respect its size and scale properties by applying them to its frames of animation.
  • A "gogo doc" command no longer compiles the current project, so now you use gogo doc when your project has syntax errors.
  • Fixed Font to work with character mapping strings that aren't in ascending ASCII order.
  • Fixed VM bug where having all-unused (null) references to an unused singleton could cause a crash on start-up due to a missing init_object() method in the singleton.
  • Android:
  • Changed a lingering "android-xcom" reference to the updated "android-xc" in platforms/android/defaults/Android-xc.mk".
  • Added missing data/ and sounds/ asset copy in Android XC build.
  • Fixed try/catch-related errors in Android xc compile (in libraries/native/slag/slag_runtime.h).
  • iOS:
  • Fixed WebView control in libraries/slag/web.slag - was checking preprocessor constant "IPHONE", corrected to newer "PLATFORM_IOS".

Change Log for 3.2.5 (February 16, 2011)

  • v3.2.4 shipped with a faulty slagc compiler that crashed as soon as any syntax error was encountered. This is now fixed.

Change Log for 3.2.4 (February 15, 2011)

  • Added Circle::fill(Color).
  • Fixed input bug due to System.os comparison against 'iphone' instead of updated 'ios'.
  • Fixed significant GC bug involving literal strings.
  • Fixed two cross-compile bugs: arrays of type Logical weren't reading/writing properly and abs() wasn't working properly on real numbers.

Change Log for 3.2.3 (February 13, 2011)

  • Fixed generics issues that occurred cross-compiling to C++.


Change Log for 3.2.2 (February 11, 2011)

  • Changed iOS to target OS 4.1 instead of OS 3.1 to support new video playback commands with a minimum of fuss and to make custom feature integration (e.g. Game Center) as easy as possible. With OS 4.x available as a free update there is a very high rate of adoption among iOS game players.
  • Added a media/ project directory designed to store videos and other large files where the system can directly access them. data/ is not a good place for videos because all the data/ files are packed into a zip archive (on some systems) and accessed via DataFile by reading the entire file into memory.
  • media/ can contain the same platform-abc-xyz and platform-not-abc-xyz subfolders as data/, images/, and sounds/.
  • Use File (instead of DataFile) to access e.g. "media/filename.mp4".
  • On iOS you must manually add various media files as project resources.
  • Added new Slag library media.slag to handle various media services, starting with VideoPlayer in this release (see next item). Be sure and add libraries/slag/plasmacore/media.slag to your Version Control when upgrading an old project. Plasmacore automatically [include]s media.slag.
  • To play a video on iPhone or Android, push a VideoPlayer screen with the filename. For example: "push( VideoPlayer("video.mp4") )".
  • Your application's update cycle will be suspended while the video plays and your original Screen will have on_resume() called on it when it's finished.
  • This currently only works on iPhone and Android. Nothing will happen on other systems, though your Screen will still have on_resume() called on it.
  • iPhone first checks your app's save/ folder for the given filename, then the base data folder, then checks resources bundled with your app.
  • Android first checks your app's save/ folder for the given filename, then the base data folder, then the unmodified filename (e.g. "/sdcard/developername/videos/video.mp4"), then your app's assets/media folder. If you place "video.mp4" in your project's media/ directory, it will load correctly when you push VideoPlayer("video.mp4").
  • If you're upgrading an Android project, edit AndroidManifest.xml to add the new <activity> tag for the VideoPlayer (as seen in platforms/android/defaults/AndroidManifest.xml). Also add platforms/android/defaults/VideoPlayer.java to your Version Control.
  • Android NDK r5b is now directly supported. The build file will automatically look for an r5b installation first and an r4b installation second. You can specify a different version in your local.properties file as directed by the build script.
  • ENUMERATE now allows negative integers. For example: 
 ENUMERATE
   north, east, south, west, none=-1
  • Fixed reversed math between a scalar LHS and a Vector2 RHS. For example, 'n / v' was being calculated as 'v / n'.
  • Fixed access methods so they can be called recursively. For example, if "planet.position" were defined as "return parent.planet.position + &position", only the first planet would call its parent's getter method; the parent planet's recursive call would access its parent's position directly instead of through the method.
  • Fixed bug where an older DataFileWriter would save old data on top of a newer DataFileWriter's data. Its close() method was getting called twice - once manually and once automatically on GC or at the end of a program and it wasn't tracking that it had already saved the data.
  • Fixed bug in XMLParser due to String modifications in 3.2.0.
  • Fixed bug in Mac audio where a specific sound would sometimes no longer play.
  • Updated iOS project's Base SDK from "iOS 4.1" to "Latest iOS" (currently iOS 4.2).

Change Log for 3.2.1 (January 26, 2011)

  • Fixed MouseEvent::is_button_release() in libraries/slag/plasmacore/input.slag to check for the button_release event type instead of the button_press event type.
  • Fixed stack traces to include current line number (!).
  • Fixed bugs in throw...catch handling.
  • Renamed RandomNumberGenerator members next and advance to be next_random and advance_random instead to avoid cluttering the global namespace.
  • Renamed Screen::next() to Screen::advance() - the old method still works but is deprecated.

Change Log for 3.2.0 (January 16, 2011)

Platform Changes

  • Added Windows Phone 7 support.
  • Added Linux support.
  • Added cross-compile option for Windows and Mac builds. Type "gogo build-xc" to do a cross-compiled build for the current platform - you'll be prompted to download the windows-project or mac-project modules if you don't have them, and you'll need Visual C++ Express or Xcode installed.
  • Platform "iphone" has been renamed to "ios". "platforms/iphone" becomes "platforms/ios", "gogo iphone-vm" becomes "gogo ios-vm", etc. See also the Source Project changes, below.
  • Android now bundles resources with the distributable. The separate resource downloading system has been deprecated.

Syntax Changes

  • You can now use "Int" or "Integer" interchangeably with "Int32". You can now use "Real" interchangeably with "Real64"
  • The as command now works with primitives as well as references. For primitives it replaces the Global methods as_Int32(Real32), as_Real32(Int32), as_Int64(Real64), and as_Real64(Int64). For example, "3.5 as Int64" gives you the integer that has the same bit pattern as the real number "3.5".
  • The colon after a method signature is now optional syntax for all methods. For example, you can either write "method print(Integer n): println(n)" or just "method print(Integer n) println(n)". The official style recommendation is to only use colons for same-line method definitions.
  • The colon after a which case or others statement is now optional. You can now write "case 5" or "case 5:". The official recommendation is to only use colons for same-line case handling, e.g. "case 5: return a + b".

Plasmacore API Changes

  • Simplified the Screen system to have a single Application.screen instead of also having the mostly unused Application.overlay.

Standard Library Changes

  • Refactored Exceptions always include a full stack trace instead of a single line. The standard to_String() returns a String in the same format as the previously existing System.stack_trace() (just the top 10 calls unless there are more than 21 total, in which case the top 10 and bottom 10 are printed). You can call to_String(Int32) to limit the output to the specified number of calls from the top of the stack.
  • String object data has a new sleek native implementation that is now opaque to Slag-side code.
  • Consequently, all String intializers have been replaced with create_from() class methods. For example, given a Char[] list chars, you must now write "String.create_from(chars)" instead of "String(chars)".
  • Added File::load().Byte[] as a companion to File::save(Byte[]). It is equivalent to File::to_bytes().Byte[].
  • Added Byte, Char, and String block data writing to FileWriter: write(Array<<Byte>>,index,count), write(Array<<Char>>,index,count), write(Byte[]), write(Char[]), and write(String). Using these methods is more efficient than writing single characters at a time.
  • Streamlined the Task class by removing configurable update intervals and the ability to suspend and resume tasks. Now when you create an extended Task it automatically updates 60 times per second and the only control option you have is to call exit() on it to halt it.
  • Removed System.memory_usage() and related functionality for now (vm/runtime change).
  • Removed wonky support for an on_error() handler in a program's main class and on_fatal_error() in class system.

Bug Fixes

  • Fixed Input.keyboard_visible to work again under the new iPhone OS. The fix: in platforms/iphone/Classes/iphone_core.mm, "text_field.userInteractionEnabled = NO;" should be "= YES;" instead.
  • Fixed "gogo pngout" in Windows as it was having trouble with the relative ".." filepath. Changed "../../.." on build_core.slag line 450 to be File("../../..").absolute_filepath.
  • Instead of giving up on a corrupted download file, Android resource downloader now makes 3 total attempts.
  • Fixed Handle location when images with altered sizes are reloaded on Android suspend/resume.

Source Project Changes

  • For iOS projects, add the following global flag to any existing main.mm files or delete your main.mm file to use the new default - see platforms/ios/defaults/main.mm more information:
bool plasmacore_allow_hires_iphone4 = false; // set to "true" if desired
  • Here are the changes you'll need if you're upgrading an old source project:
  • Preprocessor constants SVM_INTERPRETER and SVM_XCOM should be renamed to SLAG_VM and SLAG_XC, respectively.
  • In general cross-compile builds are now referred to as "XC" instead of "XCOM".
  • Remove files slag_interpreter.h/cpp and slag_loader.h/cpp.
  • Remove files slag_vm.h/cpp from a VM-based project.
  • Add files slag.h and slag_runtime.h/cpp to both VM and XC projects.
  • Add files slag_xc.h/cpp to XC-based projects.
  • If you've written custom native code you'll need to make the following name changes:
  • SVM_PUSH/SVM_POP/etc. must be renamed to SLAG_PUSH/SLAG_POP/etc. "SVM" should be changed to "SLAG" in general.
  • SVM_PERMANENT_TYPE(var_name,"TypeName") must be renamed to SLAG_FIND_TYPE(var_name,"TypeName").
  • Instead of SVM_SET(obj,SlagInt32,"property_name",new_value) you must write SLAG_SET_INT32(obj,"property_name",value) etc. - and similar for SVM_GET->SLAG_GET_INT32(var_name,obj,"property_name").
  • IMPORTANT: With references you must use SLAG_PUSH_REF(obj,"property_name",new_value) instead of SLAG_PUSH(SlagObject*,...) so that object reference counts are adjusted appropriately.
  • The Windows utility iconsmash.exe has been moved from libraries/native/plasmacore to bin/windows. It is only installed when you install platform-windows-project.

Slag Language Tools

  • The Slag language and tools are now available as a separate download from http://code.google.com/p/slag
  • You do not need to install these for Plasmacore unless you wish to use Plasmacore on Linux.
  • Installing Slag will allow you to make command-line Slag programs - type "slagc filename.slag" to compile your programs and "slag filename" to execute them.
